When humidity appears on the lung's surface, especially when it is accompanied by a chill from congestion, it is necessary to evacuate the malady at the onset with medicinal emollients, and then cauterize that part of the throat where the infection has taken hold.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And be careful not to harm the throat with the cautery or to irritate the patient's wound, but only slightly.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And apply a cautery to that or another cautery as needed to the joint of the neck at the last vertebra of the patient.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	The cautery of him is nailed in the manner previously described.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then take care of that as described above until it is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIII
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On the cauterization of pulmonary maladies and cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and pulmonary maladies are caused by excessive humidity, and the patient has no fever or phlegm, and it is an old condition, then cauterize in two places with cautery on the furcula at the affected spots of the lungs and another cautery in the middle part of the foot between two mamillary points; and both cauteries are nailed as described above.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, your puncturing cautery may be the one called a point, the shape of which precedes the puncturing of ear pain.

Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On cauterization of the throat, which is the aid's head.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the aid's head is dislocated due to slippery moisture and does not stay during its return, you should reduce its dislocation until it returns to its normal position, then place the patient on their back or side; and lift the thigh that was affected by the dislocation towards the upper part of the body, using your left hand, if the joint is dislocated inward.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then light the cautery, which has two points; this is its shape.
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	And then cauterize the wound where that one penetrates into the other side; and the figure of the cauterization will be when two points of the cautery are involved.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	and so it is subtle according to the quantity of attempt; this is its form.
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And sometimes it is adjusted according to this rule, and thus the cauterization is made of eight points.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	And then place the entire cautery on the wound with salt, and make the patient lie in tranquility, and do not move the member for any time until it is healed.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is in the joints above and it persists, then cauterization is made over the muscle with a clamping cautery or a pointed cautery, for the joint is confirmed, the moisture is dried up, and the malady is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter .XXVI.
De cauterizacio del stomac.	On the cauterization of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When stomach pain occurs with burning and moisture within, causing the expansion of gas, if you continue with treatment methods without consideration, it will be seen that the illness will shift to the patient's back, spreading their intestines and organs, and so three cauteries should be applied: one cautery leaving a mark on the foot corresponding in size to a finger, and two cauteries on either side of the back's ribs, forming a triangular cauterization figure; and those that are not properly adjusted will cause gangrene.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery is equal to two-thirds of the thickness of the skin.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And the shape of the cautery should be according to this form. If you wish, apply a larger cautery in the middle area of the stomach, also in this form; and this should be a circular cautery, like this:
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And the stomach should be cauterized by puncturing it, as this cautery frightens some: you know how much point you want to apply, and then cauterize that with cautery on the points; and take care of the cure for what is preceded until it heals.
Capitol .xxvii.	**Chapter 27.**
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	**On the Cauterization of the Vein.**
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When pain in the vein arises from coldness or moisture or strong wind, and the malady has been treated as we have said, and it does not subside, then know that the malady is lifted onto its neck, and apply three cauterizations with this form and this much force on the vein beneath the hip bones, which brings about the recumbent position of a man.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And the space between each cautery should be according to its thickness, and the cauteries should be according to the length of the body on the right side.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not hesitate with the use of cauteries.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the amount of moisture adhering to the quantity of the specific nature of the wound, and it is not too adjusted; and if the illness stands on the patient's feet; and if it is not, then let them sit, who has already extended their things and raised their arms.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And with your skill and caution in the art, you can cauterize these cauteries with a cutlass cautery.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And be careful not to burn too much during cauterization, and focus the gaze of all present so that the whole body is heated and penetrates into the intestines, for here the cautery is delicate; and know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	**Chapter 28.**
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	**On the Incision of an Abscess in the Foot with Cautery.**
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When an abscess in the foot needs to be incised and you want to know whether the abscess is in the flesh or in the tunic of the foot, if it is in the flesh of the foot, the disease takes on great gravity and the pain becomes acute.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the tunic of the foot, the pain is very acute and often exhausts the doctors in treating it.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore, position the patient so that their neck is in the correct position; then identify the location of the hernia, and heat up the cautery that resembles a needle, whose form was previously described on the other page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And cauterize with that cautery, until the entire wound is closed, reaching the deep tissue, and until it heals completely.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And likewise, take care of that one for the healing of the other hernias until they are all healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And know that this form of cautery should only be used with the one that you have studied in the art of medicine is most effective, and for those of which you have removed many illnesses; however, on some occasions, it may be daring to perform this operation, but nevertheless, it is best if we follow these instructions.
Capitol .xxix.	**Chapter 29.**
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On cauterization of pleurisy.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	The ancient cauterization techniques of the school of Aristotle for pleurisy, according to this method, involve taking a long, thin piece of iron from the school of Aristotle, and making a point at one end, which is used on the inflamed part.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	Then immerse that in oil and heat it over fire, and cauterize the area between the continuation of the furcula and the collarbone with a cautery, placing two small cauteries below, slightly inclined towards the part where the beard is, and two cauteries inclined between the fifth rib and the scapula, slightly inclined towards the back parts; and another cautery in the middle part of the foot; and another over the stomach, and three cauteries in the back parts; and a cautery in the place between the two shoulders, and two cauteries on both sides of the foot, leaving the cautery between the two shoulders.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And do not cover your hand with the cautery, but hold it over the wound in action.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And they also speak of other ancient practices where certain men use a hot iron cautery, like a ray and fire, to burn that area between the ribs, in order to reach that point and heal it, as we have said about the hernia.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	One should not fear this cautery perforation, for it often happens in the infected area of the fistula, where healing does not occur.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	On cauterization of the melza (or esophagus).
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When treating the illness of the melza (esophagus) using the methods we have discussed for healing in the hernia, do not apply your treatment without first cauterizing it; the cauterization should be done in one of three ways, all of which are correct: one is to make three or four incisions along the length of the melza according to the shape of the cautery marks on the hernia, whose shape has preceded it.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And between each cautery, the thickness of a finger or slightly less, and the manner of the cautery is the manner we have described for the cautery of the flesh entirely.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not apply the cautery with your hand; and the patient should be lying on their back.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	And there is another way of cauterizing, which is that you ignite the cautery with two directions, causing the same effect as we described in the chapter on the dislocation of muscles, raising the cord that is at the end of the membrane so that it lies without pressure on the patient's left side.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And your elevation should be such that you raise the cord according to the length of the body, so that cauterizations are made according to the extent of the wound.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	Then, with both directions lit, insert them into the space where they penetrate the cord from the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then remove the cautery; thus four cauteries are made.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you see, cauterize with a cautery having three comings.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	Then you should care for the cauterizations so that they do not become infected for too many days, as it is more comfortable than other causes preceding in the treatment.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXXI.
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	On the cauterization of hydrophobia.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Cauterizations do not cut into hydrophobics but solely into the throat.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When treating hydrophobia using the methods we have described, and if your treatment does not yield results, then know that you cauterize in the circuit of the throat with four cauterizations: one around the epigastrium, another on the diaphragm, another on the melsa, and two between the spinal processes, as well as a cauterization directly on the foot, and another over the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the depth of the cautery should be determined according to the severity of the wound.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And then apply the cautery gently so as not to cause pain for a long time.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not remove the patient from treatment just after applying the cautery, as two intentions should be added to it, and it will be celebrated with aids for healing.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the cautery used to cauterize the stomach should be according to the form that is previously done, and it is that which is used to cauterize the back in the shape of an olive as per its previous form.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter .xxxii. (Note: "Capitol" seems to be a misprint, assuming it refers to the heading of a chapter)
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	On the Cauterization of Feet and Thighs.
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet are immersed in water and filled with salt water, you should cauterize the feet on the arch of the foot between the big toe and the little finger, holding the cautery with your hand, but do not twist it; then raise your hand, but do not completely remove it, as the salt water will drain.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	The cautery should be performed as follows: Then make two cuts on each side with a cautery, and at the tip of the cautery blade, make a cautery on each part.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And the cautery should be according to the length of the part: one should be placed on both ends and the other in the middle of the affected area; and two cauteries on each part.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	And keep the wound open for a long time to prevent any water from remaining in it.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And then address those causes that we have mentioned.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter .xxxiii.
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	On the cauterization of abdominal parts.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When abdominal parts are infected and humid, it is necessary to eliminate the foul humors, which are the digestive and retentive virtues located in the stomach and intestines. This is treated using curative methods and not through excessive cauterization, as often witnessed with patients suffering from malady who display exaggerated cautery on their abdomen. One should cauterize this area with a large cautery over their stomach, as previously mentioned for cauterization of the stomach, along with small cauteries in a circular pattern around the navel and four cauteries in a circular motion around the subtle openings of the bowels. Additionally, one may use a subtile clavicle cautery or two cauteries.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if the humidity and malady persist, one should cauterize over the anus and intestines, strongly applying two cauteries over the stomach and near the inguinal region, as this is a perfect cure for a condition that does not return.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter .xxxiv.
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	On the cauterization of old hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When there are old hemorrhoids in nature, caused by a thick humor or corrupted humidity, and they do not heal with the methods mentioned in the previous section, then cauterize them with three cauterizations over the pus left on the spinal ridge, forming a small triangle, and another cauterization above the navel on both sides.
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	And if it is observed that the patient's stomach is chilled and their food is not digested, and their face appears pale, then cauterize over the stomach with a large cautery as mentioned before; also make a cautery on the tongue, and another cautery on the patient's palm using a nail cautery, leave the cauteries open for some time, and then tend to them until they heal.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter .xxxv.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	Regarding the cauterization of hernias, they remove them through incision.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you remove the hernia, you use a cautery that resembles a ray.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Next, insert that flame into the hernia incision, and finally place your hand over it to ensure the cautery reaches the opening of the vein from which the blood flows.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And do this once or twice, for if the hernias are too numerous, you cauterize each one as we have mentioned, and then care for them with ointments until they heal.

Capitol .xxxvi.	**Capitol .xxxvi.**
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	On the cauterization of fistulas that are formed in the natural openings of the body.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not obey the work that we have recommended in its proper place, and the patient is afraid of it, then use cautery for healing.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore, when one sees a fistula in nature that is old and corrupt with corrupted moisture, then it is most fitting to attempt to heal it gently, and afterward, carefully consider the quantity and depth of the opening to be treated as previously mentioned.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Then bring the cautery close to the opening that is similar to a ray.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	And then apply that ignited cautery to this fistula, according to the quantity in which it intercepts the attempt.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And apply the cautery repeatedly until those corrupt bodies are consumed after one or two or three times, according to your need's quantity.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	And be careful of nerve and vein combustion; if a fistula goes to the bladder or intestinal cavity, then pay attention to all those areas; and do not perform this unless the fistula is in fleshy tissue and you think it is not penetrating.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	And tend to the area until it is healed.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the area is sealed and all foreign matter has been removed from it, and it remains thus for a long time, then know that it is completely healed.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the foreign matter is not from the body, then know that it is penetrating or causing corruption in its place, and falls under those causes of which there will be remembrance in its location.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter .xxxvii.
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	On cauterization of ulcers.
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When ulcers cause pain due to cold or excessive heat, and the patient's condition worsens, it is necessary to cauterize them using a hot iron over each ulcer, especially where they are most painful.
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And we should cauterize very gently according to a small space, so that three cauterizations will come in succession, and thus they will be more easily healed.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter .xxxviii.
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	On cauterization of the bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When the bladder is weakened and softened by friction and moisture such that the disease cannot retain urine, apply a cautery to the discharge point on the bladder, starting from the hairline, and cauterize with a needle at another point on the right side, and at another on the left side.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the depth of the pain; apply a cautery at the deepest point of the pain, or two cauteries if necessary.
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And the cautery should be driven in according to the process.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter .xxxix. (Note: "Capitol" is likely a typo, as it seems to refer to a chapter number)
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	On the cauterization of the breast.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When fever and moisture appear, conception is prohibited, and the patient's menstruation becomes corrupt, making conception delayed, and causing pain during their period, then the place should be cauterized with three cauteries around the navel, as we have said about the cautery of the bladder; or with two cauteries, one on each side, or a 'key' cautery.
Capitol .xl.	**Chapter XL.**
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	**On the Cauterization of the Dislocated Ankle.**
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moist mucous membranes infiltrate the ankle joint, causing it to dislocate, and this condition is characterized by one side of the joint being prolonged over the other when compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the location of the dislocation is compressed in it by the weight of the body.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then apply the cautery to the hernia at the opening of the anus, making it circular like a ring, for you will have already tested the tightness of the circumference around the opening as it is rotated, and thus the opening falls in the middle of the ring.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And the cautery mentioned above, its shape is also used in the cauterization of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	If this cautery is not available to you, then cauterize it with three large olive-shaped cauteries.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And make the cautery according to the severity of the inflammation in all the body, and take care that only the healthy parts are treated.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter XLII (42)
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the cauterization of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain appears in the lower part of the body due to friction and moisture, the ailment is treated with the water we have mentioned and should not be ignored, as it is an ancient practice. Then you should drain the malady from thick humors using foul pills or artificial pills or similar ones; and apply a cautery to that area.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the application of the cautery in that area follows two methods: either with medicinal burning agents or with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	It follows two scientific methods, one of which involves cauterizing that area across the leg opening with three triangular cauteries according to this form and making sure they penetrate well.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And the space between each cautery should be according to the thickness of the said area, and whether the cautery is olive-sized or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	Sometimes, four cauteries can be applied over the middle area on top of the anquas (belly button).
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	And if you wish, cauterize the circle from which the form is derived in the cauterization of the dislocation of the ankle, one that is a circular band containing and burning away all the inflammation.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the manner of cauterization in chronic pain when it is confined to the ankle and not extended into the thigh.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	If it is extended into the thigh, then cauterize two points on the thigh at the place where you apply the malady that causes the pain; and one cautery on the shin for four days, slightly above the inner part.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cautery is cuticular, then the depth of the cautery should be according to the amount of inflammation in the vein.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the malady causes the pain to spread close to the place of the feet, then cauterize here with a number of points, three or four, or as many as you need.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the patient feels pain in the area where the cushion is placed, then cauterize it with a cutting instrument.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And be careful in all cauterization so that you do not harm nerves or cause great pain, and thereby do more harm to the patient or cause contraction.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And you have already seen some of those who cauterize on the shin and complete the cauterization, and the bed of fire is inflated until the tumor has reached the foot, and the fire penetrates and corrupts the entire foot.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And then apply a strong acid solution of the belly, and thus it causes death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two parts, then cauterize each according to this manner.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And the wise ones say about the cauterization of a pointed cautery, of which this is the manner: make it like a circular iron ring whose circumference is the width of a palm; and its orifice should be according to the thickness of a date palm bone or somewhat less.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And within that circle, there should be another third; and the space between them should be the width of a night's rest; and those circles should be cut in two parts; and the length of those sides should be one or two nights, and they should be decently garnished with iron along the edges of the circles; and this is its form.
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Then light it in the fire until it curls and sparks, and then stop it over the opening of the water, placing the patient on their side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And thus, cauterize that area with three pointed cauteries all at once.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a poultice to it, leave it open for three days, cover it with a border again and keep the ulcer exposed for several more days, and continue treatment with ointment until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Albuscas (or Albucasis), sons, of this kind of cautery we have used little due to the fear of regard it, and because few have we found that regard it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	Apply the best cautery to him who suffers from it, and find a suitable place for it.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	The best cautery as a medicine is that you make two circles with a perforated armature made of iron, in which the keyhole of the door is placed; let the length of the wall be such that their diameter or width is two nuts or the like.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the space between certain parts is such as to match the thickness of your finger, leave them open above and below, and place others around them that hold them according to this form.
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	And then apply pressure over the area where the ankle pain is felt by the patient, and take your hand off the swelling; and take some cold water, and pour it between two circles, and its quality should be such that the fire diminishes little by little, and you hold it for as long as an hour, and the patient endures the biting and tightening of the pain — for that tormenting bite is like fire — until the biting ceases.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	Then raise your hand with the instrument and drain all the cold water from the affected ankle with warm water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	And then wrap it up for three days, applying pressure on the affected area until the swelling subsides, and continue this for several days, as it is effective in healing; this is the best treatment for young patients.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with a poultice until it is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain is spread within the thigh or leg, make him lie in a position that retains water as it is done in a bath.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the manner of the water treatment, and you have already written about it in the treatise on the rectification of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Prepare a solution of alkali and cause no exting in both parts, then tie them and place in a new wave from which the opening is perforated by a small tool according to the quantity that enters it.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And then let the bottom of the wave rest on another wave filled with hot water, and place over it the live alkali and cause of the hot water, taking them in your hand for a moment, and then press them to the tieua ma (presumably a medical tool) for good compression, and leave the wave that descends from the hot water into the opening left by the cold wave.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	And then adjust all that water, and pour it over another living cause and another alkaline renewing, so that it becomes a very powerful sharp substance, which is administered in many medical operations and in the cauterization of the other members, because operation comes from fire.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And among these medicines are some that are cauterized widely, thus quickly and skillfully combined and cause a strong reaction so they may be mixed.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	He then recounts an ancient man's operation and cure for the pain of water (possibly hydrocele) and sciatica, marveling greatly at this method, saying that it requires no other treatment, as it heals entirely with a single procedure, strong heating the intricate part in a bath until it is completely healed.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And it is that it should be done near a certain green plant, and if it is not possible to obtain the green plant, then take a recent fig; many times twist it with a little salt and place it in the water where the pain is, or on the thigh, or on the leg, and let it soak.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And it should be left for a duration of three hours or for as long as the patient's condition allows for relaxation from the adjustment.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	Then immerse him in water and when the patient's body is warmed, insert the hot compress into the sole, as the pain ceases and healing occurs.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And be aware that under no circumstances should anyone use these remedies with cautery unless it is for the purpose of cleansing the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	You may already know that when the vein in a goat's foot is cauterized with a narrow flame, it benefits the animal; and the cautery should be applied to them according to this method: take wool and dip it in ancient oil, then place it between the toes of the foot and between the bones.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	Then take a dry goat's vein and apply it to the flame until it is charred, and place it on the wool, letting the inside expand.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	And then repeat this process, and do not cease to do so until the sensation of the bite disappears into the water and the pain is alleviated.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this method of cautery is called the cow cautery.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter .xlii.
De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	On the cauterization of joint pain.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	Sometimes the pain in the back is caused by various reasons, such as tension or impact, or excessive evacuation, and for similar causes, due to the introduction of foreign, irritating material.
E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	And cauterization does not apply to any other type but this specific one, which is caused by the effusion of irritating material.
Donc cove, aprop evacuacio del malaute am pillulas fitidas e am semblant a lor, que sian faytas sobre·l dos en le qual es la dolor tres linhas segon la latitut de lu, pus que senhas am tentha en quascuna linha v cauteris o mays, segon la quantitat que ve de la tolleransa del malaute e de la vertut de lu.	Therefore, to achieve evacuation of the malady, one prepares pills that resemble them, which are applied on the side where the pain is felt, in three lines according to its extent, and uses cautery on each line as much as necessary, depending on the severity of the malady and the strength of the treatment.
E sia fayta cauterizacio am cauteri de punt.	And cauterization should be done with a pointed cautery.

Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XXXIII
De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	On cauterization at the onset of jaundice.
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	This malady often manifests in young children, and the sign of its onset in children is that their small joints become stiff, evening hindering elevation and motion.
E atrobas en le derier espondil del dos e dels notz de lu que ja comensa a sobremontar sobre les autres spondils.	And it examines the last vertebra of the spine and the nerves that begin to protrude over the other vertebrae.
E donc quan tu vezes aquo e voles prohibir, lahoras cauterisa aquel am cauteri que sia cercle segon aquesta forma:	And so when you observe this and wish to prevent it, you use a pointed cautery to make a circle in the following shape:
que prengua le cauteri sobre tota partida del spondilh engualment.	that takes the cautery over all parts of the spine thoroughly.
E si vols, cauteriza en le circuit del spondilh am le cauteri de punt dos linhas o tres.	And if you wish, use the pointed cautery on the circular spine to make two or three lines.
E sian les puntz propdas entre lor.	And the points should be appropriate among themselves.

Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV.
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	On the cauterization of gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	And thus, when gout caused by cold is treated in this manner and the pain does not subside, then the remedy is cautery.
E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	It is because you cauterize the immediate evacuation in the circulation of the joint of the foot using fire cautery.
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And take an olive cautery, whose form is as follows:
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery.
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar. And if you find that these cauteries are sufficient for your needs, then cauterize the area and do not press too hard with the cautery, just sufficiently to target the specific part of the body.
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	If the pain persists within the toe and its surroundings, then administer the cautery as described in the previous chapter.
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	And if the pain is only in the feet and it is called gout, then points should be made on the course of the filaments as they turn, on those two lines.
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	And if the pain persists in these, then make points on the course of the filaments around each knot and on the pinch of the hand.
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	And if the pain can also affect the joints or muscles, then apply cautery to some parts of the limbs.
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	And do not evacuate the malady without proper treatment and reception of medicines; for if good regimen is followed and the inflammation is drained with this cautery, it will be healed, God willing.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter .xlv. (This appears to be a roman numeral indicating the title or chapter number, rather than a translation.)
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	On cauterization of fractures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When there is a fracture in the angles and the intestines are exposed due to the hernia pushing against the genitals, treatment begins as follows: it is important that the patient fasts on the day of the procedure and uses gentle means to reduce the hernia to prevent it from protruding from the abdomen.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	Then guide the patient between your hands on their back, and instruct them to breathe deeply where the hernia or intestines protrude or are about to emerge.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	Then return the intestine to its place and gently attempt to reduce the hernia over the os of the penis, marking the end of the hernial orifice similar to a circle on the upper openings of the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And now, light the cautery whose shape is as follows:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	Within which there is much heat and inflammation.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	Then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	And then place the cautery over that sign with your hand, and apply it straight, focusing on the bone of the toe within the middle of the foot; and repeat that another time if you have not achieved it in the first attempt onto the bone.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And observe wisely the position of the hernia during the cauterization, lest you injure it and cause the hernia or other great malady to return onto the patient.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And be aware that when you use a cautery, do not touch the bone, do not interfere with your operation.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And take care that the cautery on children should be delicate according to their size and measure.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	And be careful with the site of the cautery for three days, applying hot compresses until the burning sensation subsides.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And be careful with those who have other burns, taking care of them until they heal.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And the patient should be laid on their back for ten days until the site is sealed and the pain subsides.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And be aware that the diet of the patient should be adjusted according to the duration of their recovery, so as not to strain their abdomen, and prevent the intestine from protruding due to effort during healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And when it is deemed fit to remove it after approximately ten days, then administer a suitable treatment, and continue for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And it should also reduce labor and the intake of food and drink, and avoid loud voices, for when this regimen of healing is followed diligently, complete recovery will follow.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And now I will describe the treatment for hernias in other parts of the abdomen, which begins with cauterization of the hernia using a red hot iron, according to its size, and this should be done when the hernia is protruding from the abdominal wall; then apply the care as mentioned earlier, and do not tighten it.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And some experts have said that the hernia should be cauterized with a triangular iron in this manner, as it is easier to apply and effective.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And it is a pause line that they use for the width in the skin above the rupture, and another line on top of it; then place your hand with a pointed cautery, but the first cautery is lighter and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter XLVI.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	On the cauterization of twists.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When pain in other parts of the body is caused by injury or impact and continues for a long time without yielding to treatment with medicines, then it is appropriate to cauterize using a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And the cautery should be done on every member according to its size and depth, and the nature and location of the twist and pain in it.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Therefore, if it is healed by the first cautery, good; otherwise, repeat the cauterization on it; for usually these pains are punctures in the members closest to it, so you must achieve those with cautery until the illness is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter .xlvii.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	On the cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Leprous people sometimes require cauterization due to severe damage, especially if it is the type of leprosy caused by putrefaction of flesh and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	So, when you wish to cauterize it, consider whether the leprosy is progressive and if it can be cured with what we have mentioned in the previous division, nor does it retract or spread, and fear regarding the disease that corruption might encompass all of the body and all its complexities. Then cauterize it on the head using a cautery: at the middle part of the head, and at the second position beneath it, treat the forehead at the end of the hairs; and both on two horns; and also behind, over the nape or serve accordingly.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally, with your hand apply the cautery slightly so that it creates a slight impression on the bone, and dislocates the scabs, so that the expulsion of thick vapors is facilitated from it; and cauterize over the poultice as necessary.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	If leprosy has already spread over the patient and appears manifestly, then you should cauterize those places with those cauteries that we have mentioned above; cauterize on the tip of the nose, and make two cauteries on each eyelid, and make two cauteries on both spines of the neck, and make six cauteries on the spine of the back, and one large cautery on the spines near the coccyx, and one over the scapula, and two on each ankle, and one on each toe, and two on each thigh, and two on each muscle, and cauterize the tendons of their feet; cauterize over all the joints of the hands and feet, and on each heel of their feet, and on the sole.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And be mindful of the nerves that are on the leg, do not irritate those.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And in some cases, cautery is performed with a hot iron on the bone of the thigh, and on another part over the mouth of the stomach, and on another still over the sinew.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And you know that the more precise the cautery, the greater its benefit and effectiveness; and also know that the patient feels no pain from the cautery, as they do when their wounds are left open, for thus the body is already stunned.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And understand that the size of the cautery should be great or small according to the members and joints, as previously mentioned regarding the kinds of instruments.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then be careful with the cautery, applying it to the wound with fine flour mixed with honey and other remedies, as long as it heals.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter .xlviii.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	On cauterization (the application of heat) for stupor.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a member is stuck or numbed and treated with medicines, oils, and bandages, but remains unsanated, then you cauterize the stuck member with a cautery according to the size of the member or the extent of its numbness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And the hot cautery should enter the deep tissue slightly.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that area with an ointment until it is healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And sometimes stupor (numbness) is cauterized in areas such as the hands and feet, the spine, and around the nerves which cause that member to lose sensation, and the numbness is relieved.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	Do not attempt to treat this without someone who is knowledgeable about the anatomy of the body's members and the exit of nerves throughout the whole body's movement.
Capitol .xlix.	**Capitol .xlix.** (Capitol 49)
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On the cauterization of moles that are infected.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When moles are old and do not respond to any of the medicinal applications, then cauterize them with a pointed cautery for a short time according to the quantity of the specific type of cord within, until the white and color of it is reduced, and its color changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	Then prepare a mixture of flour from oats and lentils with warmed oil and arnica leaves, or pigeon dung or owl dung, each in equal parts, and apply it to the area until it is healed.
Capitol .l.	Chapter I.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	On the cauterization of cracks.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer begins to form and you wish to remove it, then cauterize it with a circular cautery around its circumference as it is turned.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And the sages say that it should be cauterized with the last cautery on the middle part; but to me, this does not seem right, as I fear it might become an ulcer, and I have seen this a few times before.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	It is much better to cauterize around the hernia in a circle as we have said, or with several cautery points.
Capitol .li.	Capital.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	On cauterization of abscesses.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When an abscess is delayed in maturation, it may be due to excess moisture, or the state of the illness, as it grows old and weak, with little vitality, or because of time, and you wish to hasten the maturation of the abscess; then cauterize around the hernia with several small punctate cauteries; and apply pressure to it, as it will aid in its maturation.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	If you wish to make the incision with a cautery, then heat the cautery whose form is thus: and pause it in the middle place of the thickest part until the thread penetrates.
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the cautery is applied at that place which is most painful, in order to relieve the pressure on the arm, then take care that it heals properly.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter II.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On cauterization of corrosion.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corrosion is a spreading decay in the member which corrodes it as if fire were consuming dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you encounter that corrosion in a place which is to be cauterized with fire, then heat cautery claws, both small and large, as appropriate for the location where the corrosion is.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then apply a cautery all around until you eliminate all corruption and do not leave any cause for it.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	Then bind it for three days, and apply oil mixed with the cautery marks on the areas cauterized daily, until all scars are completely eradicated and all corruption eliminated.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	Then take care of it with a poultice of fresh meat.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	It may be three days before the meat is completely healed without corruption, which is good; if not, repeat the cautery on what is broken in the corrupted areas.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And corrosion is treated occasionally with sharp medicine, because it takes the place of cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	However, cautery with fire may be more beneficial for young people.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And you have already spoken of the cure for him with sharp medicine in the division, so take that which you will need from him immediately.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter LIII.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On the cauterization of wounds and similar conditions.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Occasions where cauterization is indicated for the parts around a malady of the foot, which is called a claw, and it's a protrusion, causing pain; and cautery on these takes place in two ways: either with hot fire or with cold water cautery.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	The hot fire cautery is done by igniting the cautery instrument similar to a bird's quill, made of iron according to the quantity of the claw in all its parts, and it should have fine edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then apply heat to the joint, and carefully turn your hand with the cautery around the joint until the cautery reaches the depth of the joint.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And leave that for three days until it begins to heal.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And then apply a paste made from wild mallows mixed with salt to the affected area, and leave the paste on for one night so that it purges the root of the issue.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then dress the wound with a ointment of generated flesh until it heals.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if these remedies do not help, and painful incidents occur on the surface of the body, especially in the joints and feet, then apply your cautery with water, taking a small pipe of earth or iron or a needle, and place it over the joint; pour a little water into the pipe, hold your hand, and turn the pipe around with compression from your hand until you feel the water begin to drain out of the base of the joint. Wait for the patient to experience the burning sensation of the water for about an hour, then remove it, as the joint will have released its toxins at that point.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And thus they do to those who have it, bringing all of them together in the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then they take care of those pus that the roots of the clots have been eradicated with these ointments which nourish the flesh.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter III.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On cauterization of tremor.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When you encounter any tremor caused by irritation of the nerves or fever from a painful cause or other similar reason, you must cauterize it with four cautery points or two on each side of the spine, between each vertebra with one cautery; and also cauterize the foot, and over the stomach with olive cauteries.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the tremor of the patient ceases and hastens the healing of the painful illness.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter .LV.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On the cauterization of accidental burns on the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When burns appear on the body and pustules open up due to corrupt, thick matter, begin by treating them with a pointed cautery or a thin piece of wood, extending its tip over the fire; or shave off the long barbs with a razor; or apply a lenticular cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	In some cases, cautery is also applied at the beginning of their expulsion according to this method; they are not hardened, and by removing the excess, they heal those affected.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	However, it may be necessary to perform an evacuation through phlebotomy.
Capitol lvi.	Chapter LVI.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	On the cauterization of flux of blood from an accidental wound through incision of the artery.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Wounds that exhibit flux from an artery incision must be treated with caution, as this indicates a severe condition or the onset of apoplexy or cauterization of the limb, and it appears difficult to control.
